title: CLAUDE.md
text: file provides guidance Claude Code (claude.ai/code) working code repository.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: R package called connector.sharepoint provides convenient interface accessing interacting Microsoft SharePoint sites directly R. extends connector package support Microsoft SharePoint sites.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Main Class: ConnectorSharepoint (R6 class) - Core connection object inherits connector package Factory Function: connector_sharepoint() - Creates new ConnectorSharepoint instances Authentication: Uses AzureAuth package via get_token() function SharePoint authentication Integration: Designed work main connector package can used independently

title: CLAUDE.md
text: R/sharepoint.R - Main connector class factory function R/sharepoint_methods.R - SharePoint-specific methods (CRUD operations) R/token.R - Authentication token management R/connector_imports.R - Package imports dependencies R/connector-sharepoint-options.R - Configuration options

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Run all tests devtools::test()  # Or use testthat directly testthat::test_check("connector.sharepoint")

code: # Build and check package devtools::check()  # Load package for development devtools::load_all()  # Generate documentation devtools::document()  # Build package devtools::build()

code: # Build pkgdown site pkgdown::build_site()

title: CLAUDE.md
text: project uses GitHub Actions NovoNordisk’s reusable workflows: - check_current_version: Version checking - pkgdown: Documentation site generation - coverage: Test coverage reporting - megalinter: Code linting formatting

title: CLAUDE.md
text: connector (>= 0.1.1) - Base connector framework Microsoft365R - Microsoft 365 API interface AzureAuth - Azure authentication R6 - Object-oriented programming checkmate - Parameter validation zephyr - Additional utilities

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Example YAML configuration available inst/config/example_yaml.yaml use connector package framework.

title: ConnectorSharepoint
text: vignette guide process connecting SharePoint site, retrieving data, performing various operations using package.

title: ConnectorSharepoint
text: get started, need establish connection SharePoint site. Use ConnectorSharepoint() function authenticate connect SharePoint site. ’s example :
code: library(connector.sharepoint)  # Connect to SharePoint con <- connector_sharepoint(site_url = "sharepoint_url")

title: ConnectorSharepoint
text: using connector package, can connect SharePoint site using connect() function. function based configuration file list creates connectors() object connectorfor specified datasources (detailed explanation look connector package). Configuration file connecting SharePoint look like : Save _connector.yml file use connect() function connect SharePoint: Now can access SharePoint site using db object adam field inside . setup done can use connection manipulate Sharepoint data.
code: library(connector)  # Create connector object db <- connect() # Connection to SharePoint site. This will print object details db$adam

title: ConnectorSharepoint
text: connector packages provide set functions read write data datasources. similar interface, ’s easy switch . Now, show read write different types data /Sharepoint. examples using iris mtcars datasets. example writing data ADaM table: Now, let’s read data back manipulate bit write SharePoint. way can save different types data different formats.
code: library(dplyr)  # Manipulate data  ## Iris data setosa <- iris |>   filter(Species == "setosa")  mean_for_all_iris <- iris |>   group_by(Species) |>   summarise_all(list(mean, median, sd, min, max))  ## mtcars data cars <- mtcars |>   filter(mpg > 22)  mean_for_all_mtcars <- mtcars |>   group_by(gear) |>   summarise(     across(       everything(),       list("mean" = mean, "median" = median, "sd" = sd, "min" = min, "max" = max),       .names = "{.col}_{.fn}"     )   ) |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(     cols = -gear,     names_to = c(".value", "stat"),     names_sep = "_"   )  ## Store data db$adam |>   write_cnt(setosa, "setosa", overwrite = TRUE)  db$adam |>   write_cnt(mean_for_all_iris, "mean_iris", overwrite = TRUE)  db$adam |>   write_cnt(cars, "cars_mpg", overwrite = TRUE)  db$adam |>   write_cnt(mean_for_all_mtcars, "mean_mtcars", overwrite = TRUE) library(gt) library(tidyr) library(ggplot2)  # List and load data db$adam |>   list_content_cnt()  table <- db$adam |>   read_cnt("mean_mtcars")  gttable <- table |>   gt(groupname_col = "gear")  # Save nontabular data to sharepoint tmp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".docx") gtsave(gttable, tmp_file) db$output |>   upload_cnt(tmp_file, "tmeanallmtcars.docx")  # Manipulate data setosa_fsetosa <- db$adam |>   read_cnt("setosa") |>   filter(Sepal.Length > 5)  fsetosa <- ggplot(setosa) +   aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width) +   geom_point()  ## Store data into output location db$output |>   write_cnt(fsetosa$data, "fsetosa.csv") db$output |>   write_cnt(fsetosa, "fsetosa.rds")  tmp_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") ggsave(tmp_file, fsetosa) db$output |>   upload(tmp_file, "fsetosa.png")

title: ConnectorSharepoint
text: vignette showed connect SharePoint site, read write data . also showed use connector package connect SharePoint manipulate data using connector package.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cervan Girard. Author, maintainer. Vladimir Obucina. Author. Novo Nordisk /S. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Girard C, Obucina V (2025). connector.sharepoint: Connect Microsoft SharePoint easily. R package version 0.0.5.9000, https://github.com/novonordisk-opensource/connector.sharepoint.
code: @Manual{,   title = {connector.sharepoint: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily},   author = {Cervan Girard and Vladimir Obucina},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.5.9000},   url = {https://github.com/novonordisk-opensource/connector.sharepoint}, }

title: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily
text: connector.sharepoint package provides convenient interface accessing interacting Microsoft SharePoint sites directly R. vignette guide process connecting SharePoint site, retrieving data, performing various operations using package. package meant used connector package, provides common interface interacting various data sources. connector.sharepoint package extends connector package support Microsoft SharePoint sites.

title: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily
text: can install connector.sharepoint package using following command:
code: # Install from CRAN install.packages("connector.sharepoint")  # Alternatively, you can install the development version from GitHub: devtools::install_github("novonordisk-OpenSource/connector.sharepoint")

title: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily
text: Package meant used alongside connector package, can used independently well. example connect SharePoint site retrieve data: connecting SharePoint, need provide URL SharePoint site. default, token retrieved AzureAuth package using get_token() function, can provided user, used authenticate user SharePoint site. Example use connector object:
code: library(connector.sharepoint)  # Connect to SharePoint con <- ConnectorSharepoint(site_url = "sharepoint_url") # List content con |>   list_content_cnt()  # Write a file con |>   write_cnt(iris, "iris.rds")  # Read a file con |>   read_cnt("iris.rds") |>   head()  # Remove a file con |>   remove_cnt("file_name.csv")

title: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily
text: example can used connector package configuration YAML file (information take look connector package):
code: # Connect using configuration file yaml <- yaml::read_yaml(system.file("config", "example_yaml.yaml", package = "connector.sharepoint"), eval.expr = TRUE)  connector <- connector::connect(yaml)  # List content connector$test |>   list_content_cnt()  # Get SharePoint connection object connector$test |>   get_conn()  # Write a file connector$test |>   write_cnt(iris, "Test/iris.csv")  # Read a file connector$test |>   read_cnt("Test/iris.csv")

title: Connect to Microsoft SharePoint easily
text: welcome contributions connector.sharepoint package. suggestions find issues, please open issue submit pull request GitHub.

title: Connector Object for Sharepoint class, built on top of connector::Connector class — ConnectorSharepoint
code: if (FALSE) { # Connect to Sharepoint cs <- ConnectorSharepoint$new(   site_url = Sys.getenv("SHAREPOINT_SITE_URL") )  cs  # List content cs$list_content_cnt()  # Write to the connector cs$write_cnt(iris, "iris.rds")  # Check it is there cs$list_content_cnt()  # Read the result back cs$read_cnt("iris.rds") |>   head()  # Remove a file or directory cs$remove_cnt("iris.rds")  # Check it is there cs$list_content_cnt() }

title: Create sharepoint connector object — connector_sharepoint
text: extra_class parameter allows create subclass ConnectorSharepoint object. can useful want create custom connection object easier dispatch new s3 methods, still inheriting methods ConnectorSharepoint object.

title: Create sharepoint connector object — connector_sharepoint
code: if (FALSE) { # Connect cs <- connector_sharepoint(Sys.getenv("SHAREPOINT_SITE_URL")) cs  # Create subclass connection cs_subclass <- connector_sharepoint(Sys.getenv("SHAREPOINT_SITE_URL"),   extra_class = "subclass" )  cs_subclass class(cs_subclass) }

title: Connector Logging Functions — log_read_connector
